revised_title: Investigation of Polychloroprene Structure and Light Treatment Effects
tldr: The authors examined the structure of polychloroprene using X-ray methods and studied the effects of light treatment on its properties. They found that light treatment caused cross-linking of the long-chain molecules, leading to increased resistance to stretching and insolubility. The crystalline structure of polychloroprene remained unchanged, with the unit cell possibly being orthorhombic and containing four chloroprene units.
